items.title: Mojito
items.description: Delivering zesty lime with fresh mint and a backbone of crystal clear, smooth Captain Morgan® White Rum, the classic Mojito cocktail recipe has all the ingredients for a great party – enjoy it with the crew!

items.title: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Soda
items.description: A version of the classic mixed drink that uses the blended Johnnie Walker Red Label for a well-balanced, clean, delicious drink to enjoy on many occasions. #letscocktail

items.title: Peach Metro
items.description: The simple addition of tonic creates a surprising burst of zesty, deliciously fruity peach with a sweet bitter combination that provides a delicious finish to this popular drink.

items.title: Alabama Slammer
items.description: Rich almond notes, fruity Sloe Gin and fresh orange meld for this fruit-and-nut classic that's perfect for parties – on the rocks or as a shooter.

items.title: Peach Schnapps & Lemonade
items.description: The lemonade mixer lengthens and lightens the peach flavour, making a subtle drink that's ideal for warmer days, or when you want to think of good times spent in the sun.

items.title: Vodka Rickey
items.description: Unlike the Gin Rickey, the inventor of the vodka version is unknown, but this mixture of cool, triple-distilled vodka with a balancing lime juice and sugar syrup, then topped with soda is a classic sweet-sour mix that has stood the test of time.

items.title: Kiss Above the Clouds by Cross Yu

image.alt: Kiss Above the Clouds by Cross Yu

items.recipeName: Kiss Above the Clouds by Cross Yu
items.description: Based on a Manhattan, Kiss Above The Clouds was created by Cross Yu, China’s Bartender of the Year. It’s rich and warm, smooth yet complex, with a long lasting finish, and garnished with a small homemade side of grilled orange and cinnamon that complements the drink’s chocolate flavours.

items.title: Peach Schnapps & Orange Juice
items.description: A less well-known combination that mixes the subtle sweetness of the Peach Schnapps with tart, fresh orange juice for a great drink that's ideal at any time.

items.title: Lady Killer
items.description: There’s a whole spectrum of luscious, tropical and summer fruits in this cocktail that, when combined with London Dry Gin and elegantly stirred, make a fabulous drink.

items.title: Peach Schnapps & Pineapple Juice
items.description: A double serving of warm climate fruit gives you a sense of being out in the sun, great for mixing when you have friends over and want to create that holiday feeling.

items.title: Aviation
items.description: A great mix of flavours, the Aviation cocktail is the perfect introduction to gin cocktails. This citrussy, lightly floral blend of gin, maraschino and lemon is a classic cocktail recipe from the Jazz Age, when aeroplanes were the latest thing and exotic enough to inspire bartenders.

items.title: Angus Collins
items.description: A sour based on the huge peat-smoke that’s typical of southern Islay whisky, the powerful flavour, attractive garnishes and tasty mixers of this cocktail make it the ideal party serve.

items.title: Long Island Iced Tea
items.description: An unusual blend of vodka, gin, tequila, rum and orange liqueur with cola, the Long Island Iced Tea flavours of vanilla and lightly tannic wood make it taste a little like tea, but in fact they come from a mix of quality aged spirits.

items.title: Baileys B52
items.description: The B52 is the classic shot. Its impressive looks are worth the effort, but don’t overlook its delicious creamy, orange and coffee flavours as well.

items.title: Baileys Chocolat Luxe
items.description: New Baileys Chocolat Luxe captures the rich flavour and velvety texture of delicious dark chocolate in an intense, luxurious drink that delivers your favourite Baileys with truly indulgent appeal.

items.title: Mango Fizz
items.description: The tropical taste of mango combines with mint, lime and fiery Ginger Ale to create a deliciously zesty long drink.

items.title: Baileys Chocolate Orange
items.description: The perfect Christmas cocktail, Baileys Chocolate Orange mixes the classic flavours of the season, chocolate and orange, for a delicious, indulgent serve.

items.title: Baileys Eggnog
items.description: The classic, homely combination can be done deliciously and simply as here: a pour of Baileys Original Irish Cream, plus egg, milk and a pinch of nutmeg for a great serve.

items.title: Manhattan
items.description: The yin to the martini cocktail's yang, the Manhattan is one of the all-time great classic cocktails, a rich, sweet blend of whisky, vermouth and bitters that’s generally stirred into perfection.

items.title: Margarita
items.description: Nothing says Mexico like the Margarita, an elegant blend of tequila, fresh lime and orange, served in a salt-rimmed glass – and the last of the great classic cocktails.

items.title: Martinez
items.description:
All that glitters is not gold, and sometimes the best things in life aren’t staring you in the face.
The Martinez cocktail recipe might not have a pile of biscuits layered on top, or smoke pouring over the side, but it’s the ultimate drink – impressive in its own way.
Mix up a Martinez cocktail because it has both history and flavour on its side.

items.title: Merry Mule
items.description: Kick your party into action with this fine Merry Mule cocktail recipe. It’s the right way to spice up your Christmas party – a combination of tasty Ginger Ale and vodka that will have guests galloping over to celebrate.

items.title: Mojito Ho, Ho
items.description: Enjoy this laugh-a-minute Mojito Ho, Ho cocktail recipe, with a splash of Caribbean rum and a drop of joviality in the spirit of Santa. This mix of Captain Morgan Original Rum, Ginger Ale, mint and cranberry will be the centre of attention at your festive gathering.

items.title: Baileys Freakshake
items.description: Get your Freakshakes on! It’s time to enjoy the Baileys Freakshake, a cocktail recipe with so many layers of naughty deliciousness that your guests might remove one when you’re not looking. Wave them off with one hand as you blend with the other, and make sure you’ve the full dairy quota in this delicious recipe. Milk it for all it’s worth!

items.title: Moorea Volcano by Diego Barcellos
items.description: Inspired by an island paradise, Moorea Volcano perfectly balances the sweet and citrus notes of Blanco Tequila with the fresh lemon juice and sugar found in homemade coriander syrup.

items.title: Baileys French Dream
items.description: This takes the coffee and Baileys combinations so beloved of party guests one step further with the addition of raspberry liqueur. You’ll see why people love this so much.

items.title: Baileys Honey Bee
items.description: A real crowd-pleasing combination of honey and whisky, with Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur that ramps up the delicious creamy texture, this leads to a subtly sweet finish that lingers on the palate.

items.title: Baileys Iced Frappe
items.description: Enjoy a delicious cold coffee, known as 'frappe', that's made with Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur and blended until smooth, offering a great drink for warmer days with a few friends.

items.title: Baileys Latte
items.description: The classic drink that's an espresso lengthened by hot milk is enriched and lifted by a pour of delicious Baileys Original Irish Cream, adding a subtle creaminess.

items.title: Baileys Midnight Mint
items.description: Regularly treated as the ideal after-dinner drink, this fine, shaken combination of Baileys Original Irish Cream and mint liqueur also works as a fantastic aperitif.

items.title: Baileys Orange Bliss
items.description: The ultimate indulgent drink, combining the ultimate luxury cognac and Orange Liqueur with the rich, creamy textured Baileys Original Irish Cream.

items.title: Negroni
items.description: With Mediterranean herbs, a hint of orange and gin botanicals, the Negroni recipe is full of flavour – and history. This classic Italian cocktail is loved by bartenders for its subtle bitterness and use of vermouth.

items.title: Paloma
items.description:
Created by bartender Don Javier Delgado Corona, the Paloma is considered by many Mexicans to be their native cocktail, even above the more internationally known Margarita.

Corona has invented a drink that is essentially a long, fruity Margarita. Inevitably with the local spirit close at hand there are bound to be ever-increasing renditions of the Margarita.

items.title: Baileys Original Irish Cream & Coffee
items.description: Brew a pot of freshly made coffee to complete the rich, subtly creamy texture of Baileys Original Irish Cream for this drink that's finished, cappuccino-style, with shavings of chocolate.

items.title: Baileys Original Irish Cream Hot Chocolate
items.recipeName: Baileys Original Irish Cream Hot Chocolate
items.description: A delicious variation on the classic hot chocolate drink, this adds a fabulous rich, creamy dimension that's not hard to create but made to be savoured with a few friends.

items.title: Baileys Over Ice
items.description: A simply satisfying drink that can be enjoyed by anyone, anytime. Smooth sweet Baileys poured over ice satisfies as soon as it touches your lips.

items.title: Baileys Pumpkin Spice Latte
items.description: The Baileys Pumpkin Spice Latte is for lovers of latte with a little extra. And that seems to be quite a few of you, as pumpkin spice is the flavour of the moment. Just beat the takeaways by making it at home using Baileys Pumpkin Spice Liqueur.

items.title: Non Alcoholic Mojito
items.description: Mint, apple, lime and elderflower combine to create this refreshing mocktail Mojito, topped with Soda Water. #letscocktail

items.title: Passion Fruit Caipiroska
items.description: Fruity, lively and deliciously balanced, with great-tasting vodka as its base, the Passion Fruit Caipiroska is a twist on classic Brazilian cocktail the Caipirinha that’s perfect for a summer of great sport.

items.title: Basil Grande
items.description: One of a number of great cocktails created by bartender Jamie Wilkinson when at the Living Room bar in Manchester, dating from 2001, this fine long drink blends raspberry liqueur, strawberries and tart cranberry with Ketel One Vodka for a delicious red fruit mix.

items.title: Penny Black
items.description: This fine mixed drink takes the great mixing qualities of Scotch Whisky and adds sour, sweet and bitter in the form of grapefruit, honey and a dash of bitters for a burst of flavours.

items.title: Blended Scotch Whisky & Ginger Ale
items.description: This simple drink tastes so impressive because the ginger ale picks out the spicy elements in a quality Scotch whisky blend, making for a punchy serve that’s great on the palate.

items.title: Pimm's No.1 & Lemonade
items.description: You can do plenty with Pimm's – a garnish here, lots more strawberries and cucumber there – but sometimes just a pour of lemonade makes for a great-tasting drink. #letscocktail

items.title: Pimm's No.1 & Ginger Ale
items.description: If it’s summer it’s Pimm’s – whether you’re celebrating, watching sport or just spending time with friends. So give your favourite outdoor tipple a touch of ginger ale. It’s a spicy twist on the classic drink, the coolest serve with a difference.

items.title: The Crisp And Citrus Johnnie & Lemon
items.recipeName: The Crisp And Citrus Johnnie & Lemon
items.description: An easy-to-mix splash of lemonade with delicious blended whisky, this clean, long drink is perfect for time spent relaxing or with friends, a great way to savour the classic spirit.

items.title: Between the Sheets
items.description: A fine little number from the days of Prohibition, Between the Sheets is a spirituous, citrussy martini packed with Morgan's and Orange Liqueur spice. Enjoy a taste of the 20s!

items.title: Pimm's Punch
items.description: The punch has been around since the 17th century as the ideal sharing drink that combines five delicious ingredients, and the Pimm’s Punch celebrates fruit, with flavours of apple, zesty citrus and tart passion fruit – plus the delicious herb-tinged fruits of Pimm’s No.1.

items.title: Pink Lady
items.description: An elegant mixture of gin, fruity grenadine rounded out with egg white, and balanced with lemon juice, the Pink Lady cocktail recipe was once the gin cocktail of choice – and when it comes to mixing for your next party you’ll see why.

items.title: Pomelo
items.description: A long cocktail that combines the grapefruit-like taste of the Pomelo with sweet orange juice and brandy, it’s a great fruity drink with serious mixing credentials.

items.title: Port in a Storm
items.description: One of the great mixed drinks using two base spirits, this combines Johnnie Walker Red Label with cognac, but also the fortified Port for a dark, richly flavoured cocktail.

items.title: Raspberry Caipiroska
items.description: Simple to make, zesty and delicious, the Raspberry Caipiroska is a twist on the classic Brazilian cocktail, the Caipirinha, with ripe fresh fruit pressed together with a dash of sugar to create the ideal summer sport serve.

items.title: Rich and Famous
items.description: A rich, creamy and striking blend of Baileys Original Irish Cream and Gold Vodka, Rich and Famous is the ultimate indulgent cocktail recipe. Grab a taste of the good life.

items.title: Blackberry Shrub Cocktail
items.description: Gordon’s Blackberry Shrub cocktail.

items.title: Bloody Mary
items.description: The ultimate brunch cocktail, the world's favourite savoury drink, the Bloody Mary delivers a balance of sweet, salt, sour and umami flavours that is unlike any other.

items.title: Rob Roy
items.description: Created in 1894 by a bartender at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City, the Rob Roy is a mix of Scotch whisky and vermouth that delivers a burst of sweet, earthy and spicy flavours.

items.title: Blue Lagoon
items.description: A brilliant, turquoise 1970s classic, the Blue Lagoon may look and sound tropical, but it's a deliciously tangy, citrus harmony of vodka, blue curaçao and lemonade.

items.title: Rum and Cola
items.description: Rum and Cola is an all-time classic recipe, with subtle caramelly cola and a zesty wedge of lime that’s best enjoyed with crystal clear, rounded flavour of delicious new Captain Morgan® White Rum.

items.title: Brandy Alexander
items.description: A version of the Brandy Alexander using Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur, this captures the spirit of the cocktail as a delicious, creamy variation.

items.title: Rum Caipirinha
items.description:
A delicious take on the classic Caipirinha cocktail, this Rum Caipirinha drink blends the rich, full flavour of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold rum with zinging lime and sugar.

Evoking tropical getaways and the spirit of celebration, the Rum Caipirinha is one of the great party drinks.

items.title: Bourbon & Cola
items.description: A version of the classic dark spirits with cola, in the form of the American spirit of choice Bourbon, the vanilla flavours in both combine beautifully for a fine mixed drink.

items.title: Rum Espresso Martini
items.description: The classic Espresso Martini gains extra intensity from the rich, dark Caribbean flavour of Captain Morgan rum. With fresh-brewed espresso and coffee liqueur, it’s deliciously indulgent.

items.title: Bourbon & Ginger Ale
items.description: A great party drink, with a pour of ginger ale picking out the delicious, spicy wood notes of a quality base spirit in the form of Bourbon for a classy serve.

items.title: Rum Punch
items.description:
Captain Morgan Original Rum and Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold provide a base of distinctive richness and mellow spice for this delicious drink with historic connections.

Pair with lush tropical fruit flavours plus a hint of citrus for a fine, celebratory serve.

items.title: Bourbon & Soda
items.description: This simple mix is a surprising hit, with a zesty, clean pour of soda loosening the rich vanilla and clove flavours of tasty Bourbon for an impressive long drink.

items.title: Rusty Nail
items.description: Combining Scotch whisky and Drambuie, the Rusty Nail is high up on the list of cocktails made with Scotch, and makes for a wonderfully indulgent blend of heather flavours, spices and sweet caramel.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Cola
items.description: The classic combination that's drunk around the world, it highlights the subtly sweet vanilla and caramelised flavours common to both Captain Morgan Original Rum and cola.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Cranberry Juice

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Cranberry Juice

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Cranberry Juice
items.description: A sharp, fruity cranberry tang adds a twist to the caramelised, vanilla flavours of Captain Morgan Original Rum for a great, simple-to-make drink that your guests will love.

items.title: Savoury Eggnog
items.description:
Have you heard about the Eggnog with a cheeky savoury twist? Well, if you like a Bloody Mary, you’ll love this creation.
Combining Johnnie Walker Black with Egg and cream plus Worcestershire Sauce and celery salt make the Savoury Eggnog as warm and filling as it is delicious.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Ginger Beer

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Ginger Beer

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Ginger Beer
items.description: Mix this pub classic at home whenever you have the opportunity, combining classic dark rum flavours of Captain Morgan with sweet, dry hoppy beer and spicy ginger.

items.title: Classic Old Fashioned
items.description: Arguably the world's oldest cocktail, the Old-Fashioned is a deceptively simple blend of whiskey, sugar and bitters, and a must for any lover of dark spirits seeking perfection in a glass.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Lemonade
items.description: This easy-to-make combination uses lemonade to lighten both look and taste for a fresh, sparkling long drink, subtly picking out the great tastes of Captain Morgan Original Rum.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Orange Juice

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Orange Juice

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Orange Juice
items.description: A simple mix of fresh orange juice with tasty dark Captain Morgan Original Rum makes this a versatile combination for any occasion – on your own or when with friends.

items.title: Singapore Sling
items.description: Sweet, rich cherry brandy cut through by zesty citrus and finished with delicious gin botanicals: the Singapore Sling is one of the great cocktails, although arguments over its exact recipe exist.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Pineapple Juice

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Pineapple Juice

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Pineapple Juice
items.description: Add a tropical touch with a pour of pineapple juice that picks up on the Caribbean connections of Captain Morgan Original Rum for a delicious mixed drink.

items.title: Slim Santa
items.description:
Believe it or not, yes this is a Slim Santa – all ready to be poured into your glass.
Santa’s been working out, running around getting your presents ready, and the Slim Santa is the result – a combination of vodka, lemonade and pomegranate that’s the colour of Christmas. You’ll be red-y to serve this delicious cocktail in an instant.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Rum Mai Tai

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Rum Mai Tai

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Rum Mai Tai
items.description: The ultimate Tiki drink, a tangy, refreshing blend of dark rum and tropical fruit, the Mai Tai is Hawaii in a glass. Ideally, of course, in a Tiki glass.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Cola

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Cola

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Cola
items.description: There's a reason why this simple combination is such a classic: it's the flavour match of vanilla and caramel in both the cola mixer and Captain Morgan, here with an extra, spicy twist.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Diet Lemonade

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Diet Lemonade

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Diet Lemonade
items.description: Low in calories, but with a light zestiness, the lemonade highlights the spicy flavour of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold for great easy drinking on the patio or in the home.

items.title: Slojito
items.description: A version of the modern classic Mojito cocktail, this swaps in London Dry Gin and basil for the traditional rum and mint combination that leaves a great lingering taste.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Ginger Ale

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Ginger Ale

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Ginger Ale
items.description: A double dose of delicious spice that fills the palate, with sweet caramel and vanilla flavours in Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold balanced by a pour of dry ginger ale.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Lemonade

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Lemonade

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Lemonade
items.description: A simple mix of fizzing mixer and spicy base spirit, this drink is easy to make but a really tasty combination that’s great for sharing with friends and family.

items.title: Vodka & Apple Juice
items.description: A simple and tasty aperitif, vodka and apple juice is an elegant, tart mixed drink that can be garnished with a slice of apple for extra effect.

items.title: Vodka & Bitter Lemon
items.description: A tangy lemon kick from the bitter lemon mixer complements the clean, smooth base spirit of vodka. It’s sweet, tasty and makes for a great aperitif serve.

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Orange Juice

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Orange Juice

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Orange Juice
items.description: A pour of the citrus fruit mixer makes for a lighter coloured but spicy orange drink that tastes like Christmas but can be enjoyed by you and friends any time of the year.

items.title: Vodka & Cola
items.description: A classic mixture of two iconic drinks, this adds sweetness to the clean, sharp flavours of vodka for a great serve. It also happens to be one of the world's most popular drinks.

items.title: Vodka & Cranberry Juice (New Yorker)
items.description: Officially called a Cape Codder, this simple mixture is effortless to make but tastes great, with a tangy, fruity edge to the smoothness of vodka, that’s ideal for parties. #letscocktail

items.title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold Apple

image.alt: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold Apple

items.recipeName: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold Apple
items.description: A delicious take on the autumnal dish of spiced apple that takes Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, adds a pour of apple juice and ends up with a great long drink.

items.title: Vodka & Diet Cola
items.description: A classic and easy-to-make drink that’s simple and tasty, this has a cola taste that complements the clean vodka finish. One of the world's most popular mixes, this version is also low in calories.

items.title: Clove Bitters
items.description: Clove bitters adds aromatic spice, and is the ultimate component to the deliciously festive London Dry Gin and Clove cooler.

items.title: Vodka & Ginger Ale
items.description: The sweet ginger flavour adds an extra layer to the smooth, clean taste of vodka. Ideal for a summer’s evening, it also works in winter thanks to the warming flavours.

items.title: Vodka & Grapefruit Juice (Greyhound)
items.description: The Greyhound is a tangy, citrus-edged combination of vodka and grapefruit juice that has evolved over time into a great drink.

items.title: Vodka & Lemonade
items.description: One of the world's favourite drinks, vodka and lemonade is a clean, clear, sparkling mix in which the pure, lean flavours of the vodka are picked out perfectly.

items.title: Vodka & Pineapple Juice
items.description: A hint of tropical flavour with the smooth, clean flavour of vodka, make this a perfect holiday reminder, or for drinking with friends when you have them over.

items.title: Vodka & Soda
items.description: The mix of soda and vodka is one of the most popular worldwide. Pour in a long glass with a slice of lime for a delicious, simple serve.

items.title: Bay Breeze
items.description: A delicious, sweet-tart balance of pineapple and cranberry over a vodka base, the Bay Breeze is the less famous, but more exotic variant of the classic summer cocktail, the Sea Breeze.

items.title: Ghouls’ Goblet
items.description: This spooky serve will cast the perfect spell with its sweet and sour sensations. Just don’t be alarmed when you see some creepy creatures at the bottom of your glass!

items.title: Harvey Wallbanger
items.description: A long, citrusy cocktail with subtle herbal flavours, the Harvey Wallbanger was reputedly named after a Manhattan Beach surfer, and has gone on to become a modern classic.

items.title: Kiwi Collins
items.description: The addition of kiwi fruit to this version of the Joe Collins gives a sweet and sour twist that complements the smooth flavour of vodka in an unusual but delicious way.

items.title: Long Vodka
items.description: The lime and bitters make for a tasty, sweet-sour version of the classic vodka and lemonade, adding zesty citrus flavours to lift the drink.

items.title: Madras
items.description: Colourful, fruity and refreshing, the Madras is a sharper, more citrussy version of its close relative, the Cosmopolitan.

items.title: Marmalade Collins
items.description: A delicious mix of zesty flavours, the Marmalade Collins is also one of the easiest cocktails you’ll ever make. In just under 60 seconds you can blend pure, clear vodka with sweet and sour in a jam jar for a great serve.

items.title: Cosmopolitan
items.description: There are some – a very few – cocktails that define a decade. And the Cosmopolitan, a hot pink, pleasantly sharp cocktail served in the iconic martini glass, was the essence of the 1990s. Here's our perfect version.

items.title: Dill or No Dill
items.description: The Dill Or No Dill was created especially for the World Class 50 by World Class UK finalist and London-based mixologist Gareth Evans. It’s a highly innovative cocktail with a perfect sweet and sour balance using the fresh fruit and botanicals in Tanqueray 10 as a base.

items.title: Raspberry Collins
items.description: A light and fruity blend of vodka, fresh lemon juice, sweet sugar and muddled strawberries, this impressive-looking drink is ideal for summer parties with friends.

items.title: Screwdriver
items.description: This classic 1960s drink, comprising a perfect pairing of vodka and fresh orange juice served over plenty of ice, is back in vogue today thanks in part to US TV hit series Mad Men.

items.title: Sea Breeze
items.description: A crisp, refreshing blend of vodka, cranberry and grapefruit, served long over plenty of ice, the Sea Breeze is a simple, timeless cocktail that is redolent of bright summer days.

items.title: Frozen Mary
items.description: Freeze! Stop right there and mix up your Frozen Mary cocktail. It’s a delicious blend of bold, spicy flavours with vodka, tomato juice, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco plus plenty of ice all whizzed up. Yes, you can chill out with a little heat!

items.title: Dirty Martini
items.description: Like so many classic cocktails, the Martini has a long history riddled with more fiction than fact, but the Dirty martini draws no arguments as to its method.

items.title: South Side
items.description: Essentially a Mojito with London Dry Gin instead of rum, this cocktail is named after one of Chicago's most famous districts, and packs a sweet-sour punch.

items.title: Blanco Tequila & Cola
items.description: An unusual combination, but truly a delicious one, serve Blanco Tequila and cola with a squeeze of lime for a cool, refreshing mixed drink that your guests will love.

items.title: Spiced Ice Tea
items.description: This is not a version of the classic Long Island Iced Tea – but a delicious, easy-to-mix combination of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and iced tea that’s just as good.

items.title: Erik Lorincz's One Night
items.description: With depth of flavour and perfect balance, One Night is a cocktail with credentials. It’s the creation of Erik Lorincz, head bartender at The American Bar at The Savoy and a former World Class Bartender of the Year.

items.title: Spiced Mojito
items.description: A cool, crisp, summery blend of rum, mint, lime and soda – the Spiced Mojito is a version of the classic Cuban cocktail with a subtle piquancy thanks to a base of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold.

items.title: Baileys Flat White Martini
items.description: From coffee chains across the land comes the craze for the flat white, and we’ve captured it in cocktail form with the Flat White Martini. So create your very own coffee serve in the kitchen – just don’t charge your guests for a glass!

items.title: Strawberry Daiquiri
items.description: Alongside the Cuba Libre and the Mojito, the Daiquiri is one of the three great Cuban cocktails, and by adding strawberries it gains texture and taste.

items.title: French 21
items.description: A version of the traditional French 75 cocktail, the French 21 combines vodka, lemon juice, raspberry liqueur and champagne for a striking celebratory cocktail.

items.title: Strawberry Mojito
items.description: Cuba meets the English summertime in the Strawberry Mojito cocktail recipe; a drink where juicy fresh fruit squashed with zesty lime, white rum and a touch of fresh mint makes for a berry nice combination.

items.title: French 75
items.description: Lightly sparkling, citrusy, subtly sweet and tinged with delicious botanicals: the French 75 champagne cocktail is the invention of one of the greatest ever bartenders, who mixed gin, lemon juice, sugar syrup and champagne to great effect.

items.title: Cirocstar Martini
items.description: A gorgeous, easy-drinking fruit martini with lush pineapple, rich raspberry and grape vodka, the French Martini is perfect for sharing with guests, offering a frothy top for extra effect.

items.title: Frozen Banana Daiquiri
items.description: Bring on the bananas! The Frozen Banana Daiquiri cocktail is ripe for a revival with its delicious mix of clear, clean white rum, crushed ice and best of all – bananas.

items.title: Game, Set & Match by Ash Bovey

image.alt: Game, Set & Match by Ash Bovey

items.recipeName: Game, Set & Match by Ash Bovey
items.description: Inspired by Wimbledon fever, Ash has created a new drink that captures the spirit of this classic British event, with fresh, clean Smirnoff No. 21 Vodka and a sweet–sour mix of fresh strawberries plus cranberry juice.

items.title: Summer Blossom
items.description:
Floral with a hint of fruit and bergamot – that’s Summer Blossom, full of the hopes and flavours of the early warm months.

Enjoy gin with a spot of elderflower mixed with cloudy apple juice and syrup made from Earl Grey tea to conjure up this quirky mix of tea time, apple orchards and blooming elderflower, all in one glass.

items.title: Pippa's Ultimate G&T
items.description: Less is more and there is nothing simpler than a classic Gin &Tonic, Pippa style. Her suggestion? Use only best the ingredients  for the ultimate G&T.

items.title: Bramble
items.description: Created by bartender Dick Bradsell in 1984 at Fred’s Club in Soho, London, this cocktail with the unusual addition of blackberry has become a modern classic.

items.title: Mandarin & Clove Cooler
items.description: We all know the best spreads include an aperitif. Try out our unique Mandarin & Clove Cooler, the perfect cocktail to enjoy with food and friends.

items.title: Tom Collins
items.description: Gin botanicals, citrus fruit sweetness and a touch of sourness, bubbled up with soda water – the Tom Collins is one of the simplest long drinks, such a classic that it’s had a glass named after it.

items.title: Gin Mojito
items.description: A gin-based version of the classic Mojito, switching out rum for London Dry Gin and apple instead of mint for a subtle take on the great cocktail. #letscocktail

items.title: Gin Punch
items.description: Take the delicious botanicals of London Dry Gin and build a fruit punch that makes the most of this premium spirit. The subtle grapefruit hints are heightened by an array of tasty fruit juices, making a lavish punch that’s perfect for celebrating.

items.title: Tequila Mojito
items.description: Mexico meets Cuba in this twist on the classic Mojito. With tequila in place of rum, it's a bold addition to the mint, lime, sugar and soda. Serve these at parties, mixed in a punch bowl.

items.title: Tequila Pina Colada
items.description: A play on the ultimate Tiki drink, the Tequila Pina Colada replaces rum with tequila, but keeps the pineapple and coconut for a burst of flavour that’s richly evocative and tropical in feel.

items.title: Tequila Sunrise
items.description: Clean, pure blanco tequila with sweet grenadine and delicious, subtly sour orange juice makes one of the greatest of modern classic cocktails, a drink that has a surprising place in rock ‘n’ roll history.

items.title: Gin Rickey
items.description: The Gin Rickey is a Tom Collins with lime rather than lemon, plus minimal sugar syrup, creating a citrusy mixed drink that shows off the great botanicals of London Dry Gin.

items.title: Glitterball
items.description: Subtly sweet, tangily sour and with a delicious edge of elderflower, the Glitterball is an enticingly flavoured cocktail, served in a champagne flute, that’s perfect for celebrating.

items.title: The Apple Bite
items.description: Clean, pure vodka is mixed with rich apple, sparkling lemonade and zesty lime for a drink that grabs you. Serve with friends for a great start to the evening.

items.title: The Birthday Cake
items.description: Based on rich, creamy, original Baileys that’s topped with whipped cream and sprinkled with hundreds-and-thousands, The Birthday Cake cocktail recipe tastes is simple to create and delicious. Make a wish as you take a sip!

items.title: Gin & Apple Juice
items.description: Adding apple juice is a great complement to the classic botanical flavours of London Dry Gin, making an elegant, tart mixed drink that goes down a treat.

items.title: The Elderflower G&T
items.description: Effectively a G&T plus elderflower cordial, the elderflower adds a delicious floral edge to the range of botanicals in London Dry Gin, making one of the great versions of the classic drink.

items.title: Gin & Bitter Lemon
items.description: A touch of zesty citrus flavour complements the citrus botanicals in London Dry Gin. Create a great afternoon drink with friends with a few, simple pours.

items.title: Gin & Ginger Ale
items.description: Add ginger ale to London Dry Gin for an easy-to-make, delicious spicy and subtly sweet mixed drink to have when you’re relaxing or with friends.

items.title: The Golden Flip by Theodoros Pirillos

image.alt: The Golden Flip by Theodoros Pirillos

items.recipeName: The Golden Flip by Theodoros Pirillos
items.description: The Golden Flip melds together Greek wildflower honey and tahini-infused Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve with apricot brandy and a spritz of orange zest for a richly impressive serve.

items.title: The Long Shot
items.description: Subtly sweet, bursting with fresh mint and citrus and based on delicious, vanilla-wood flavoured Bourbon plus pale ale, The Long Shot is the ideal cocktail recipe to partner great sport.

items.title: Gin & Grapefruit Juice
items.description: The sweet tartness of grapefruit juice combines with the citrus botanicals in London Dry Gin for a fruity, zesty drink that’s perfect for relaxing at home or with friends.

items.title: Gin & Lemonade
items.description: An increasingly popular variation on the G&T, the addition of lemonade makes for a light, spritzy drink that’s easy to mix and delicious, a great, simple serve.

items.title: Gin & Orange Juice
items.description: Also known as Gin and Juice, this simple-to-make, popular drink switches in orange juice for the more commonly used soda for a tasty mix that is incredibly easy to make.

items.title: The Mint Oreo Shake by Sarah Mitchell

image.alt: The Mint Oreo Shake by Sarah Mitchell

items.recipeName: The Mint Oreo Shake by Sarah Mitchell
items.description: A creamy, chocolaty mix of classic Oreo cookies that’s perfectly blended with milk, vanilla ice cream, mint and vodka. This homage to the traditional milkshake was inspired by that old school American diner feel.

items.title: Gin & Pineapple Juice
items.description: This easy-to-make mix with pineapple juice makes for a great party drink with friends, and gives a tropical touch to the subtle citrus botanicals in London Dry Gin.

items.title: The OMG&T
items.description: Perfect after work, this quintessentially British drink has been given a fresh berry facelift that'll wow your friends and take you straight to cocktail Nirvana.

items.title: Gin & Tomato Juice
items.description: This is a ‘Red Snapper' without the spices, a tasty blend of London Dry Gin and tomato juice that delivers texture and flavour in a couple of simple pours.

items.title: Frozen Gimlet
items.description: Gimme, gimme…the Frozen Gimlet, a delicious fusion of lime with blueberries, mint, crushed ice and gin that delivers fabulous fresh fruit flavour.

items.title: Espresso Martini
items.description: A blend of vodka espresso, fresh-brewed espresso coffee, honey and Baileys Coffee, the Espresso Martini is a very modern drink based on an old classic, with a clean clear delivery of vodka, rich creamy flavours and a touch of delicious bitterness.

items.title: Sloe Gin & Lemonade
items.description: A twist on the popular modern classic of London Dry Gin and lemonade, the delicious fruit flavour of sloe berries is lengthened by the bubbly mixer.

items.title: The Moscow Mule by John G. Martin

image.alt: The Moscow Mule by John G. Martin

items.recipeName: The Moscow Mule by John G. Martin
items.description: Originally made using Smirnoff No. 21 Vodka, this simple mix of spice and citrus is one of the classics. Created by John G Martin and his bar owner friend Jack Morgan, it sparked the cocktail revolution in the 1950’s.

items.title: Sloe Gin & Orange Juice
items.description: The classic Gin and Juice recipe is given extra fruitiness with Sloe Gin, resulting in a mini-fruit burst of contrasting but well-matched flavours.

items.title: Sloe Gin & Tonic
items.description: A twist on the classic G&T, Sloe Gin adds a lip-smacking twist from fresh-picked sloe berries to the subtle zestiness of the tonic that’s autumnal in feel.

items.title: Grapefruit Smash
items.description: A delicious bittersweet marmalade with pure, clear vodka and a lively dash of citrus makes a perfect fruit smash – and you can use the marmalade jar to serve it in.

items.title: Grog
items.description: What's in a name? 'Grog' may be the worst title for a cocktail ever, but with delicious spiced rum, lime juice and honey, it's surely one of the best tasting. So open your guests’ minds – and mouths – to a surprisingly delicious drink (and just tell them it's a punch).

items.title: Hot Toddy
items.description: Get the hip flask in your bag: you can share the warmth around with a well-made Hot Toddy drink at your next party. It’s the ultimate cold-weather drink, bringing you and your friends together.

items.title: Hurricane
items.description: A spiced version of the great Hurricane cocktail, this adds a spicy touch to the zesty, fruit-flavoured cocktail that's a great party serve – and an impressive one too.

items.title: The Perfect Ten
items.description: A recipe that's made for gin, the perfect way to serve this super-premium gin and experience the delicious, whole fruit botanicals.

items.title: Jamaica Sunrise
items.description: This cocktail is the classic Screwdriver plus grenadine, the dark red liqueur adding colour and tart sweet flavour to the orange-tinged clean purity of vodka.

items.title: Jan Collins by Jeff Bell
items.description: A modern day twist on the all-American Tom Collins, the effervescent Jan Collins uses the crisp and sophisticated tasting Ketel One vodka in place of gin. The addition of the zesty orange and lemon citrus notes in the Ketel One produce a fresh tasting cocktail fizzing with flavour. Jan Collins was created by Jeff Bell for World Class 50, the definitive guide to fine drinking.

items.title: The Princess & the Pirate
items.description: A rich, creamy chocolate and subtly spicy blend of Baileys and Captain Morgan Spiced, The Princess & The Pirate is a delicious pairing of two very different characters! Enjoy with whipped cream and chocolate sprinkles for a real treat.

items.title: The Russian Iced Tea by Emma Sherwood-Smith

image.alt: The Russian Iced Tea by Emma Sherwood-Smith

items.recipeName: The Russian Iced Tea by Emma Sherwood-Smith
items.description: A zesty, cooling serve of vodka, lemon iced tea and apple juice. The Russian Iced Tea is made in a teapot for a twist on the traditional serve.

items.title: Jimmy Dean by Jenner Cormier
items.description: A whisky cocktail that’s drawn from a forest landscape, Jimmy Dean by Jenner Cormier has the deep, rich, smooth flavours of Johnnie Walker® Blue Label plus delicious homemade pear oak bitters and smoked wood for a taste of the wilds.

items.title: White Chocolate Martini
items.description: One of the more striking versions of the classic martini, the Chocolate Martini uses white chocolate liqueur for a striking-looking drink and rich, cocoa-butter flavours that blend beautifully with the subtle honey of vodka.

items.title: John 'N' Pickle
items.description: Why not put a twist on an Old Fashioned with the John 'n' Pickle! With hints of chutney, this cocktail is the perfect accompaniment to an after-dinner cheeseboard.

items.title: Vesper Martini
items.description: A creation of James Bond author Ian Fleming, this classy, sweet and sour cocktail is on every bartender’s repertoire, ordered by those in the know, and made as fine variation on the martini.

items.title: Vodka & Orange Juice
items.description: Combine zesty orange juice with cool, crisp vodka for a delicious version of one of the best-known mixed drinks.

items.title: Vodka Martini
items.description: Bone-dry, crystal clear and icy cold, the martini cocktail is the ultimate classic cocktail, enjoyed by everyone from Clark Gable and Bette Davis to Audrey Hepburn and the Rat Pack.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Black Label & Ginger Ale

image.alt: Johnnie Walker Black Label & Ginger Ale

items.recipeName: Johnnie Walker Black Label & Ginger Ale
items.description: A fresh take on a whisky cocktail is this Johnnie Ginger by Tim Philips-Johansson. This wily creation merges those smoky, spicy, fruity aromas of the Johnnie Walker Black with the sweet, sparkling flare of Ginger Ale.

items.title: Vodka Tonic
items.description: One of the classic combinations, but light in calories, it's simple, light texture and flavour makes it the perfect aperitif or drink with friends, and it mixes well in various measures.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Black Label the Long Walker

image.alt: Johnnie Walker Black Label the Long Walker

items.recipeName: Johnnie Walker Black Label the Long Walker
items.description: Ginger and apple flavours deliciously complement a pour of Johnnie Walker Black Label by adding spicy and gently sweet notes, and making this one of the finest long drinks you’ll savour.

items.title: Whiskey Sour
items.description: Rounded, soft, oaky notes are cut through with lemony citrus in this classic old-timer: the Whiskey Sour is a rye whiskey or bourbon-based version of one of the world’s most famous cocktails.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Double Black Label & Soda

image.alt: Johnnie Walker Double Black Label & Soda

items.recipeName: Johnnie Walker Double Black Label & Soda
items.description: A pour of fizzing, sweet-sour soda is a delicious way to open out the intensely smoky, rich flavours of Johnnie Walker Double Black Label, creating a fine long drink for any occasion.

items.title: Whisky & Ginger with Cranberry Juice
items.description: Add this sharp, fruity cranberry juice to a spicy blend with Johnnie Walker Red Label for a crowd-pleasing mixed drink that makes a great, simple cocktail.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Mango Crush
items.description: Enjoy Johnnie Walker whisky in a way you’ve probably never tried before. Serve with crushed ice, strawberries, blueberries, mango for a deliciously tropical take on the classic Scotch with the Mango Crush recipe.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Cola
items.description: Whisky and cola is one of the world's favourite combinations, and Johnnie Walker Red Label is an ideal blend with subtle flavours lifted by a pour of the mixer.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Ginger Ale

image.alt: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Ginger Ale

items.recipeName: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Ginger Ale
items.description: A spicy lift to the perfect mixing whisky, the ginger highlights the subtle spice flavours among other great tastes in Johnnie Walker Red Label in this simple, mixed drink.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Green Tea

image.alt: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Green Tea

items.recipeName: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Green Tea
items.description: The subtle tannins of green tea combine with Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky to accentuate the peaty richness and complexity of this outstanding blended Scotch. Serve to surprise and delight guests.

items.title: White Russian
items.description: An easy-drinking blend of vodka, coffee liqueur and cream, the White Russian was a favourite during the glory days of disco. Today it is a hipster staple once again.

items.title: Woo Woo
items.description: With sour, crisp cranberry and sweet peach plus cool, clean vodka, the Woo Woo cocktail is a delicious concoction born of long, hot summers and a new wave of bartenders in the 1970s.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Jasmine Tea

image.alt: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Jasmine Tea

items.recipeName: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Jasmine Tea
items.description: Made for mixing, Johnnie Walker Red Label Scotch Whisky is perfectly balanced with a pour of fruity, flower-hinted jasmine tea. The dark leaf notes add a base flavour alongside the complex peatiness that will impress your guests.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Orange
items.description: A great way to lengthen Johnnie Walker Red Label, the zesty, citrus tang of orange juice picks out subtle fruity flavours in the whisky in this simple drink.

items.title: Zombie
items.description: Tropical, fruity and rum-based, the Zombie is one of the original Tiki cocktails. It’s a delicious punch that comes from a man by the name of Don the Beachcomber, who created a new craze for carved mugs and hula fashion.

items.title: Pimm's Royale
items.description: A version of the classic aperitif the Kir Royale, this switches in Pimm's for a deliciously fruity pre-dinner drink that also makes for a great party celebration drink thanks to the addition of champagne.

items.title: Pink Gin
items.description: A mix of London Dry Gin and Angostura bitters, the Pink Gin is delicate-looking, delicious, and about as simple as a cocktail gets.

items.title: Baileys Chocolate Orange S'mores martini cocktail

image.alt: 2 mugs of brown liquid topped with marshmallows, whipped cream, chocolate sauce and chocolate sprinkles. Surrounded by crumbs of half eaten chocolate and biscuits.

items.description: A sophisticated twist on a campfire favourite.

items.title: John Collins
items.description: This simple to make cocktail is made with fresh lemon juice, simple syrup and sparkling water. Its clean, crisp taste makes it the ideal sip for dinner parties.

items.title: Dutch Mule
items.description: It couldn’t be simpler to combine vodka, lime, ginger and sugar to balance. Perfect after a long day.

items.title: Gin Basil Smash
items.description: One of gin's more modern subcategories, this cocktail was born in 2008.

items.title: Gimlet
items.description: Simple yet oh-so-delicious, this classic cocktail is a great drink if you want to ease yourself into Martinis.

items.title: Clover Club
items.description: Dry and zesty. This cocktail is the perfect combination of pretty visual appeal and delightful texture.

items.title: Corpse Reviver
items.description: This drink was invented back in the 1930s by Harry Craddock for The Savoy Cocktail Book. This cocktail is a hit thanks to the combination of four different types of spirits.

items.title: Ramos Gin Fizz
items.description: An absolute showstopper of a cocktail. Essentially a creamy version of the Tom Collins.

items.title: Summer Punch
items.description: Perfect for sharing with friends, the Summer Punch combines the pureness and versatility of vodka with the subtle sweetness of apple juice, fresh lemon and ginger for a great party serve.

items.title: Gin Martini
items.description: Ah, the martini. A favourite drink for everyone from Frank Sinatra to James Bond (shaken, not stirred).

items.title: Rum Old Fashioned
items.description: Why have a standard old fashioned, when you can mix it up with a great, aged rum? Try this version with a different base, sugar, and bitters for a new twist on an iconic cocktail.

items.title: Apple Highball
items.description: This is a great long drink to sip on. You can pretty much use any base spirit, but we prefer it with rum.

items.title: Hotel Nacional
items.description: Named after the famous Hotel Nacional in Havana, Cuba, this signature cocktail adapts the classic Daiquiri. Lauren Mote has mixed pineapple, lime juice and apricot (or peach liqueur) for a cocktail that’s smooth in taste and big on tropical flavour.

items.title: Rum Manhattan
items.description: Global Cocktailian, Lauren Mote's vision for a mix of part spiced rum and part aged rum is visionary. This cocktail is a great way to add a little zing to a classic drink.

items.title: Rum Sour
items.description:
"The most famous sour cocktails are the Margarita and the Whisky Sour, but Global Cocktailian, Lauren Mote's Rum Sour is a great contender.

The combination of rum with zesty citrus is something to look forward to. It's easy to make, easy to switch up (all types of rums are welcome) and easy to enjoy, making it an excellent drink for celebrating life's big moments with your favourite people."

items.title: Eggnog
items.description: The festive season isn’t quite celebratory enough without a glass of Eggnog. Why not try out Lauren Mote's, it's warming and delicious in equal measure.

items.title: Winter Mai Tai
items.description: No tiki cocktail party is complete without a Mai Tai. And if you’re hosting one during the colder seasons, Lauren’s winterised Mai Tai will go down a storm with your guests.

items.title: Hot Buttered Rum
items.description: It's the heart-warming cocktail to serve at get-togethers during cooler seasons. Rich, comforting and delicious, Lauren Mote's rumbelievable drink will re-energise your guests before they head back home.

items.title: Captain Morgan's Spiced Hot Toddy
items.description: When the temperature drops, nothing beats catching up over Lauren Mote's super special Hot Toddy cocktail with your nearest and dearest. This version is a spicy twist on the traditional recipe.

items.title: Blackberry Whisky
items.description: Imagined and crafted by a master of mixology, Ervin Trykowski who summoned some of his finest flaire by marrying the worlds of blackberries and whisky in this Blackberry Whisky cocktail.

items.title: Sunrise Highball
items.description: Ervin Trykowsk has a knack for unlocking hidden depths of flavour in whisky.. This Sunrise Highball with lashings of orange soda does exactly that!

items.title: Elderflower Spritz
items.description: A toast-worthy tasty long drink made for any occasion.

items.title: Lemon Sour
items.description: When life gives you lemons, make Lemon Sour cocktails for everyone.

items.title: Penicillin Cocktail
items.description: Tim Philips-Johansson has created yet another show-stopping sip with this Penicillin Cocktail. It's warm and sweetly anointed with the Johnnie Walker Gold, honey and ginger syrup.

items.title: Garden Highball
items.description: A delicious cocktail encompassing all the refreshing flavour of the British countryside.

items.title: Vodka Espresso
items.description: A classic cocktail 99% of your party will love!

items.title: Spiced Apple Sour
items.description: This cosy sour is the perfect non-alcoholic cocktail for your festive get togethers.

items.title: Gordon's Alcohol Free Spirit winter & tonic
items.description: A seasonal Gin and Tonic twist, without the alcohol. Let’s cheers to that.

items.title: Mi-no-sa
items.description: A non alcoholic Mimosa, so so good.

items.title: Ervin's Old Fashioned
items.description: Make Ervin's Old Fashioned in a new way by crafting it in batches. This is the perfect sipper for a pre-dinner soiree.

items.title: Queen Bee
items.description: Christie Knight, the queen bee of alcohol-free mixes, has conjured up a deliciously fresh combination of  honey, lemon juice, soda water and thyme. The fresh, woody sparkle will set your night afire.

items.title: Ervin's Whisky Sour
items.description: Unlike most Whiskey Sour recipes, Ervin Trykowski's Whisky Sours aren't made with bourbon, so we do not add the letter 'e' in whisk(e)y. Instead expect sour, salty, spicy flavours in this cocktail.

items.title: Johnnie Walker Whisky Sour
items.description: A Johnnie Walker Whisky Sour made by Tim Philips-Johansson is like no other because it relies on those gently spiced vanilla notes for an extra special flavour derived from the whisky.

items.title: Whisky Colada
items.description: Try Ervin’s twist on the Piña Colada using Talisker whiskey. And We love Ervin’s take on this classic, but if you prefer your Pina with Tequila, see the original recipe.

items.title: Pink Gin Spritz
items.description: Pippa’s Pink Gin Fizz is the perfect party starter! The flirty, soft pink colour of Gordon's Pink Gin is made to sparkle with Prosecco.

items.title: Scotch Old Fashioned
items.description: Arguably the world's oldest cocktail, the Old-Fashioned, is a deceptively simple blend of whiskey, sugar and bitters, and a must for any lover of dark spirits seeking perfection in a glass. Try this twist with Johnnie Walker Scotch whisky.

items.title: Don Limonada
items.description: Karina Sánchez saw the beautiful point where fresh lemon meets the taste of sweet agave. If you're looking for a simple serve where tequila takes centre stage, this is it.

items.title: Tequila Old Fashioned
items.description: Bartender Karina Sánchez Huitrón has created a Tequila Old Fashioned that is set to wow all who taste it. Grapefruit bitters enliven the glass, while smoky, aged Añejo gives it body and makes it a sneaky twist to the original.

items.title: Tanqueray Alcohol Free 0.0% & Tonic
items.description: Enjoy one of the world’s most famous alcohol-free mixes. Experiment with tonics, the way Christie Knight does, using the same measures and find your favourite.

items.title: Grapefruit Collins
items.description: Grapefruit and rosemary are an absolutely delicious combination. Bartender Christie Knight knows the importance of drink garnish. You always smell your drink before it hits your lips, which strongly affects how you taste it. Fresh herbs always make a great garnish.

items.title: Non-Alcoholic Clover Club
items.description: Aquafaba is a great alternative to those who prefer not to use egg white in their drinks. It is the liquid from a can of chickpeas, believe it or not, doesn't add much flavour but does replicate the amazing fluffy texture of a sour. Give this recipe developed by Christie Knight a go!

items.title: Tanqueray 0.0% Gimlet
items.description: Doyenne of the no-alcohol cocktail, Christie Knight, has created a non-alcoholic gimlet using gin 0.0% with fresh lime. This mix is intense fresh and here to delight your guests.

items.title: Gin and Tonic
items.description: One of the world’s most famous mixes- the Gin and Tonic. We recommend a Gin full of juniper and botanical flavours, with the slightly bitter tonic. Experiment with different gin's & tonics using the same measures and find your favourite.

items.title: Gordon's Premium Pink Spritz
items.description:
A delicious, light, and fruity drink with
a bubbly twist and juniper notes.

items.title: Gordon's Premium Pink & Tonic
items.description:
A refreshing tasting Gordon’s & Tonic
with a fruity Pink twist

items.title: Grove & Tonic
items.description: One of our classic non-alcoholic serves with citrus notes from Seedlip Grove 42

items.title: Tanqueray Nº Ten And Tonic
items.description: One of the world’s most famous mixes- the Gin and Tonic. We recommend a Gin full of juniper and botanical flavours, with the slightly bitter tonic. Experiment with different gin's & tonics using the same measures and find your favourite.

items.title: Espresso Martino
items.description: A blend of vodka espresso, fresh-brewed espresso coffee, honey and Baileys Coffee, the Espresso Martini is a very modern drink based on an old classic, with a clean clear delivery of vodka, rich creamy flavours and a touch of delicious bitterness.

items.title: Seedlip Apple Highball
items.description: A non alcoholic Apple cocktail with unfiltered Apple Juice

items.title: Vodka Murdini
items.description: Murdoc Niccals is affectionally regarded by the Gorillaz fandom community as Pickle (ode to his green skin) and we wouldn’t put it past him to consider himself the ideal candidate for the next Bond, so it was a no brainer to take the shaken, not stirred classic and whack a pickle in it.. Hold the olive.

items.title: Smirnoff Brooklyn
items.description: Russel Hobbs is from Brooklyn, straight up (no ice) and whilst the modern Manhattan sits on the darker side, Hobbs is here to lighten things up with a twist on the OG Smirnoff vodka original recipe… He doesn’t farm chilli peppers for nothing, he’s turning up the heat to heat to with a chilli twist… Hold the cherry.

items.title: Sayonara martini
items.description: Wave goodbye to the expected and say hello to new flavours. Enter passionfruit and welcome echoes of life in Japan with yuzu sake. A delicate touch of Vanilla finishes to complete Noodle’s Sayonara martini..

items.title: Vodka Eyeball
items.description: 2D famously has a pair of eyes that for reasons unknown go from black to white and he keeps a pet satsuma. Whilst he was born and raised in West Sussex, he maintains a mockney accent so meet the 'Eyeball.' He still doesn’t know it’s actually called Highball, hence the gummy eye candies… Hold the lemon.

items.title: Baileys Salted Caramel Espresso Martini
items.description: If you fancy the suave appeal of an espresso martini cocktail but want to treat yourself, this one goes out to you. Oozing in salted caramel sauce, a perfectly frothy martini cocktail with a difference. Yum!

items.title: Baileys Chocolate Orange Martini Cocktail
items.description: Love Baileys? Love chocolate orange? Tangy, sharp sweetness meeting creamy chocolatey velvet. Tell me you don’t fancy one now I’ve brought it up…..
